qas.question: What is beers primary active ingredient?
What disease can be caused by heavy alcohol consumption?
How many deaths are believed to have been caused by alcohol?
What is the third leading cause of premature dying in the US?
How many years are removed from an alcoholic's life expectancy?
What is the main active ingredient of alcohol?
What are 3.3% of all deaths believed to be due to?
What are 5.9 million deaths believed to be due to?
What reduces a person's life expectancy by around three years?
What is the tenth leading cause of early death in the United States?

context: The main active ingredient of <b5_0>beer<b5_0/> is <a0_0>alcohol<a0_0/>, and therefore, the health effects of alcohol apply to beer. Consumption of small quantities of alcohol (less than one drink in women and two in men) is associated with a decreased risk of cardiac disease, stroke and diabetes mellitus. The long term health effects of continuous, moderate or heavy alcohol consumption include the risk of developing alcoholism and <a1_0>alcoholic liver disease<a1_0/>. A total of <a2_0>3.3 million<a2_0/> deaths (5.9% of all deaths) are believed to be due to <b6_0><b7_0>alcohol<b7_0/><b6_0/>. <b8_0><b9_0>Alcoholism<b9_0/><b8_0/> often reduces a person's life expectancy by <a4_0>around ten<a4_0/> years. <a3_0>Alcohol<a3_0/> use is the third leading cause of early death in the United States.
